page.title: 16MADELEY MANOR
page.content: Madeley Manor was once a very large family house. It was situated a mile or so South of the village, and was origi- nally mediaeval. It was fortified in 1349 to some extent, and had a double moat. Although from an engraving dated 1686 it can be seen to be an impressive building, today nothing remains except for one portion of stonework, and holl- ows in the ground to mark the position of the moats. On the remaining sandstone stonework it is possible to see the marks of the the stonemason, and also graffiti dating from Victorian times. There is documentary evidence that the Manor once had a formal walled gar- den,substantial outbuildings, a stone gatehouse,and ornamental fish ponds, containing many large carp. Now the remains are dark and gloomy,surrounded by oak trees and stagnant pools.
